metadata.title: CVE-2023-3159 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A use after free issue was discovered in driver/firewire inoutbound_phy_packet_callback in the Linux Kernel. In this flaw a localattacker with special privilege may cause a use after free problem whenqueue_event() fails.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3159` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
